**Scale mail** is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

## Generation

In addition to random generation, general [stores](/wiki/Store "Store") and used armor dealerships sell scale mail.

## Description

While worn, scale mail confers 4 base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") and [MC1](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation").

## Strategy

While scale mail is strictly better than [ring mail](/wiki/Ring_mail "Ring mail"), which weighs the same but provides 1 less [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"), both compare poorly with the [elven mithril-coat](/wiki/Elven_mithril-coat "Elven mithril-coat") and [dwarvish mithril-coat](/wiki/Dwarvish_mithril-coat "Dwarvish mithril-coat").

## History

Scale mail first appears in Hack 1.21 and Hack for PDP-11, which is based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and is included in the initial list of armor for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"). From this version to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), including some variants based on those versions, scale mail does not grant any [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation_\(3.4.3\) "Magic cancellation (3.4.3)").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Scale armour](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scale_armour "wikipedia:Scale armour")***

Scale mail is a type of armor made up of small scales fastened to a cloth or leather backing, with the scales themselves made of metal or other hard materials like boiled leather or animal horn. A related form of armor is ["lamellar armor"](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lamellar_armour "wikipedia:Lamellar armour"), which has scales stitched together without any need for a backing. Both types were made and worn by many cultures, especially in Asia.

## Variants

In variants based on NetHack 3.4.3 and earlier versions, worn scale mail may not grant any MC.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), a [gnoll warrior](/wiki/Gnoll_warrior "Gnoll warrior") has an effective 19⁄30 chance of generating with scale mail.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), scale mail grants 2 base AC and 2 [DR](/wiki/DR "DR") while worn, and its weight is reduced to 125 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum") (half its weight in vanilla *NetHack*).

[Soldier ants](/wiki/Soldier_ant "Soldier ant") on the Lawful Quest have a 3⁄10 chance of generating with scale mail fitted to their body shape, and [large dogs](/wiki/Large_dog "Large dog") have a 1⁄25 chance of being generated with scale mail fitted to their body shape.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), scale mail can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a ring mail and a [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet"). Scale mail can be used to forge a few items:

- Scale mail can be combined with [chain mail](/wiki/Chain_mail "Chain mail") to create [splint mail](/wiki/Splint_mail "Splint mail").
- Scale mail can be combined with ring mail to create [banded mail](/wiki/Banded_mail "Banded mail").

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [Warriors](/wiki/Warrior_\(role\) "Warrior (role)") start the game with non-cursed +0 scale mail.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 696](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c#line696 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c")
